text:
I saw scouts taking boxes
from the house.

They're probably
holding everything

at the Bonesborough precinct,
Francois included.

Are you sure you want
to do this for a stuffed toy?

Wouldn't you rather,
I don't know,

- have a beach day?
- Maybe if we had time

for 20 more adventures,
but we don't.
Besides, this is for King.
He needs his buddy.

Guard:
Ugh, I hate double shifts.

Can't wait till the day
after the Day of Unity.

- Know what I mean?
- Sure, but, man,

I am racking up OT
like crazy.
There! Look!
Luz: Francois!

- Let's pounce!
- Hold up.

If we're going to do this,
we got to do it right.

Belos isn't taking
any more chances with us.

Not after your little trip
into his mind.

If we want to stay alive,
we got to be inconspicuous.
Take me to my--

I mean, the Owl Lady's
confiscated junk!
Nice save.
Huh.

I would've appreciated
some kind of reaction.
These were hard to get.
Hey, you, fellow guard.

We just found a load
of illegal Hexes Hold'em cards.

Can we get the key
to the, uh, warehouse?
( elevator dings )

Why is everything
going our way now?

Maybe our luck's
finally turning.
( elevator dings )
Eda: Hoo, boy.

We're going to need to split up
if we want to find Francois.
If things get hairy,

you fly out of here
as fast as you can.
Hey, don't give me that face.
Just say okay, okay?
Okay.
Oh, and if you find a box

labeled
"Eda's longest toenails,"

- grab that, too.
- Ew.

Captain: We've secured
the Owl Lady's house.

- That's correct, Head Witch.
- Hm?
No. There was no sign of her.

Just keep looking
until you find her.

And only come to me
when you do.
Raine.

Head Witch, I'll do all I can
to find the Owl Lady.
You have my word.

Your word doesn't count
for much without results.
Just go.
( exhales )

Captain, I thought
I told you to-- Eda?

Please, just give me a minute.
I'm not trying to start trouble.
You're wearing a stolen uniform.
And I am working it.

Listen, I don't know
what you're hiding,

but I do know that
somewhere deep inside
you still care about me.

Otherwise, you wouldn't
have let me walk free
back at the coven parade.

Raine, I know about
the Day of Unity
and the draining spell.

Nope, I--
I saw that expression.

It is that bad, isn't it?
That's why I need your help.

There's no time
for your schemes, Eda.
Wait. This is for my kids.

They can't be around during
the Day of Unity.

Put them in a castle bunker,
get them on an airship--

I don't care, just--
just keep them safe.

If you do,
I'll give myself up right now.

- I--
- Come along, sprout.
Places to be, hedges to trim.

Awaiting further instructions,
Head Witch.

Stay put. I'll send someone
to receive the package.

Your uniform
looks outdated, Captain.

Looking like a pile
of compost.
Luz: Eda?
Are you sending me away?
